isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ DT, 9 and 10 Engine Service Manual - Front Cover, Cooling System, and Related Components - Clean, Inspect, and Measure

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields. Limit compressed air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi).

step1.para: Clean water supply housing, water pump, water inlet elbow, water outlet tube, oil pump housing, front engine mount, and front cover with a suitable non-caustic solvent.
Blow parts dry using filtered compressed air.
Clean coolant and oil seal mating surfaces on the cylinder head, water supply housing, water pump, water inlet elbow, water outlet tube, oil pump housing, and front cover.

Inspect alternator bracket, secondary Freon® compressor support, water supply housing, water inlet elbow, vibration damper assembly, oil pump and rotor housing, oil pump inner and outer rotors, front cover, and idler gears for cracks, damage, or excessive wear. Replace parts if required.
Inspect drive belt for excessive cracks and wear. Replace if necessary.

Inspect automatic belt tensioner and pulley to make sure tensioner arm and pulley are properly in line with the fan drive belt and not coming apart. Make sure tensioner arm is not binding and pulley bearing is not loose. Replace belt tensioner if required.
Inspect thermostat and gasket. If thermostat is stuck open, damaged, cracked, or not opening properly replace thermostat and gasket.
Inspect fan drive bearing by wiggling fan pulley. If bearing has excess play, replace fan housing or mounting bracket.
Inspect water pump. Wiggle water pump pulley. If water pump bearing has excess play, replace water pump. Inspect water pump housing for coolant leaks. Replace water pump if leaking.
